specJson.name: brightics.function.textanalytics$ner_crf_train
specJson.description:
Named-entity recognition (NER) (also known as entity identification, entity chunking and entity extraction) is a subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities mentioned in unstructured text into pre-defined categories such as person names, organizations, locations, medical codes, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc.

This function trains a CRF model to perform the named entity recognition. An input corpus must contain four columns: sentence column which identifies each sentence, token column, pos column, and label column. It is assumed that the IOB system is used and each label starts with letters 'I', 'O', or 'B'.

Reference

+ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Named-entity_recognition

table.desc: Train data including sentence info, token info, part of speech, and named entity label.

model.desc: Trained model which will be used in the NER CRF Predict function.

params.label: Sentence Column
params.description: Sentence column which identifies each sentence. It may contain sentence ID, sentence itself, etc. This value for tokens in the same sentence should be identical.

params.label: Token Column
params.description: Token column which contains a tokenized item.

params.label: POS Column
params.description: POS column which contains a part of speech information.

params.label: Label Column
params.description: Label column which contains a named entity label.

params.label: c1
params.description: The coefficient for L1 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to L-BFGS.

params.label: c2
params.description: The coefficient for L2 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to L2 SGD or L-BFGS.

params.label: Maximum number of iterations
params.description: The maximum number of iterations for optimization algorithm. Suggested default values for each training algorithm: unlimited for L-BFGS, 1000 for L2 SGD, and 100 for AP, PA, and AROW.

params.label: Use all possible transitions
params.description: Specify whether CRF generates transition features that do not even occur in the training data.

summary.en: This function trains a CRF model to perform the named entity recognition.
summary.ko: 명명된 엔터티 인식(NER: named entity recognition)을 수행하도록 CRF 모델을 학습시킵니다.

md.en: # NER CRF Train This function trains a CRF model to perform the named entity recognition. ## Description Named-entity recognition (NER) (also known as entity identification, entity chunking and entity extraction) is a subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities mentioned in unstructured text into pre-defined categories such as person names, organizations, locations, medical codes, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc. This function trains a CRF model to perform the named entity recognition. An input corpus must contain four columns: 1. sentence column which identifies each sentence, 2. token column which contains each word, 3. pos column which contains part of speech of each word, and 4. label column which contains named entity label of each word. It is assumed that the IOB system is used and each label starts with letters 'I', 'O', or 'B'. Reference + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Train data including sentence info, token info, part of speech, and named entity label. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) Trained model which will be used in the NER CRF Predict function. #### PARAMETER 1. **Sentence Column***: Sentence column which identifies each sentence. It may contain sentence ID, sentence itself, etc. This value for tokens in the same sentence should be identical. 2. **Token Column***: Token column which contains a tokenized item. 3. **POS Column***: POS column which contains a part of speech information. 4. **Label Column***: Label column which contains a named entity label. It is assumed that the IOB system is used and each label starts with letters 'I', 'O', or 'B'. 5. **Algorithm**: Training algorithm for CRF. 6. **c1**: The coefficient for L1 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`. 7. **c2**: The coefficient for L2 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to `L2 Stochastic Gradient Descent` or `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`. 8. **Maximum number of iterations**: The maximum number of iterations for optimization algorithm. Suggested default values for each training algorithm: unlimited for `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`, 1000 for `L2 Stochastic Gradient Descent`, and 100 for `Averaged Perceptron`, `Passive Aggressive`, `Adaptive Regularization Of Weight Vector`. 9. **Use all possible transitions**: Specify whether CRF generates transition features that do not even occur in the training data. ### Python #### USAGE ``` ner_crf_train(table = , sentence_col = , token_col = , pos_col = , label_col = , algorithm = , c1 = , c2 = , max_iterations = , all_possible_transitions = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Train data including sentence info, token info, part of speech, and named entity label. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) Trained model which will be used in the NER CRF Predict function. #### PARAMETER 1. **sentence_col***: Sentence column which identifies each sentence. It may contain sentence ID, sentence itself, etc. This value for tokens in the same sentence should be identical. * Type: *str* 2. **token_col***: Token column which contains a tokenized item. * Type: *str* 3. **pos_col***: POS column which contains a part of speech information. * Type: *str* 4. **label_col***: Label column which contains a named entity label. * Type: *str* 5. **algorithm**: Training algorithm for CRF. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: lbfgs ( lbfgs | l2sgd | ap | pa | arow ) 6. **c1**: The coefficient for L1 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to lbfgs. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.1 (value >= 0) 7. **c2**: The coefficient for L2 regularization. Affects when algorithm is set to l2sgd or lbfgs. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.1 (value >= 0) 8. **max_iterations**: The maximum number of iterations for optimization algorithm. Suggested default values for each training algorithm: unlimited for lbfgs, 1000 for l2sgd, and 100 for ap, pa, and arow. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 9. **all_possible_transitions**: Specify whether CRF generates transition features that do not even occur in the training data. * Type: *bool* * Default value: true ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** In this tutorial workflow, sample_ner_crf_train data is used to train a NER CRF model and to predict named entities. The generated model is afterward applied to another text data to predict named entity category of each word in the NER CRF Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **Sentence Column***: sent 2. **Token Column***: word 3. **POS Column***: pos 4. **Label Column***: tag 5. **Algorithm**: L-BFGS Gradient Descent 6. **c1**: 0.1 7. **c2**: 0.1 8. **Maximum number of iterations**: 100 9. **Use all possible transitions**: true ### Python ``` from brightics.function.textanalytics import ner_crf_train input_table = inputs[0] result = ner_crf_train(table=input_table, sentence_col='sent', token_col='word', pos_col='pos', label_col='tag', algorithm='lbfgs', c1=0.1, c2=0.1, max_iterations=100, all_possible_transitions=True) model = result['model'] ``` In this tutorial workflow, sample_ner_crf_train data is used to train a NER CRF model and to predict named entities. The generated model is afterward applied to another text data to predict named entity category of each word in the NER CRF Predict function.
md.kr: # NER CRF 학습 이 함수는 개체명 인식을 위한 CRF 모델을 학습한다. ## Description 개체명 인식(Named-Entity Recognition, NER)은 정보 추출(information extraction)의 일종으로, 비정형 텍스트 데이터에 포함되어 있는 개체명을 찾아내고 그를 사람 이름, 기관 이름, 장소 이름, 의료 코드, 시간 표현, 양(quantity)에 대한 표현, 통화량, 퍼센트 비율 등으로 분류하는 작업으로 이루어진다. 이 함수는 개체명 인식을 수행하기 위한 CRF 모델을 학습한다. 입력받을 말뭉치는 다음과 같은 네 개의 컬럼을 포함해야 한다. 1. 어떤 문장에 포함되어 있는지를 표시하는 문장 컬럼 2. 각각의 토큰을 포함하는 토큰 컬럼 3. 각각의 토큰의 품사(part of speech, pos)를 포함하는 품사 컬럼 4. 개체명 레이블을 포함하는 레이블 컬럼. IOB 시스템을 따라 각각의 레이블은 'I', 'O', 'B' 중 하나로 시작해야 한다. Reference + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 문장 정보, 토큰, 품사, 개체명 레이블이 포함된 텍스트 데이터 테이블. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) 학습된 CRF 모델. 추후에 NER CRF Predict 함수에서 사용된다. #### PARAMETER 1. **Sentence Column***: 어떤 문장에 포함되어 있는지를 표시하는 문장 컬럼. 문장 ID나 문장 자체가 들어갈 수 있다. 같은 문장에 포함된 토큰에 해당하는 행들은 이 값이 일치해야 한다. 2. **Token Column***: 토큰화된 결과를 포함하는 토큰 컬럼. 3. **POS Column***: 토큰의 품사 정보를 포함하는 품사 컬럼. 4. **Label Column***: 개체명 레이블을 포함하는 레이블 컬럼. IOB 시스템을 따라 각각의 레이블은 'I', 'O', 'B' 중 하나로 시작해야 한다. 5. **Algorithm**: CRF 학습 알고리즘. 6. **c1**: L1 정규화 계수. `Algorithm`이 `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`로 설정되어 있을 때 유효하다. 7. **c2**: L2 정규화 계수. `Algorithm`이 `L2 Stochastic Gradient Descent` 또는 `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`로 설정되어 있을 때 유효하다. 8. **Maximum number of iterations**: 최적화 알고리즘을 위한 반복 횟수의 최댓값. 각각의 학습 알고리즘에 대해 추천하는 기본 값은 다음과 같다. - `L-BFGS Gradient Descent`: 무제한 - `L2 Stochastic Gradient Descent`: 1000 - `Averaged Perceptron`, `Passive Aggressive`, `Adaptive Regularization Of Weight Vector`: 100. 9. **Use all possible transitions**: CRF 알고리즘에서 전환 피쳐(transition feature)를 생성할지 여부. 학습 데이터에 포함되어 있지 않더라도 생성한다. ### Python #### USAGE ``` ner_crf_train(table = , sentence_col = , token_col = , pos_col = , label_col = , algorithm = , c1 = , c2 = , max_iterations = , all_possible_transitions = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 문장 정보, 토큰, 품사, 개체명 레이블이 포함된 텍스트 데이터 테이블. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) 학습된 CRF 모델. 추후에 NER CRF Predict 함수에서 사용된다. #### PARAMETER 1. **sentence_col***: 어떤 문장에 포함되어 있는지를 표시하는 문장 컬럼. 문장 ID나 문장 자체가 들어갈 수 있다. 같은 문장에 포함된 토큰에 해당하는 행들은 이 값이 일치해야 한다. * Type: *str* 2. **token_col***: 토큰화된 결과를 포함하는 토큰 컬럼. * Type: *str* 3. **pos_col***: 토큰의 품사 정보를 포함하는 품사 컬럼. * Type: *str* 4. **label_col***: 개체명 레이블을 포함하는 레이블 컬럼. IOB 시스템을 따라 각각의 레이블은 'I', 'O', 'B' 중 하나로 시작해야 한다. * Type: *str* 5. **algorithm**: CRF 학습 알고리즘. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: lbfgs ( lbfgs | l2sgd | ap | pa | arow ) 6. **c1**: L1 정규화 계수. algorithm이 "lbfgs"로 설정되어 있을 때 유효하다. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.1 (value >= 0) 7. **c2**: L2 정규화 계수. algorithm이 "l2sgd" 또는 "lbfgs"로 설정되어 있을 때 유효하다. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.1 (value >= 0) 8. **max_iterations**: 최적화 알고리즘을 위한 반복 횟수의 최댓값. 각각의 학습 알고리즘에 대해 기본 값으로, lbfgs는 무제한, 12sgd는 1000, 그리고 ap, pa, arow에 대해서는 100을 추천한다. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 9. **all_possible_transitions**: CRF 알고리즘에서 전환 피쳐(transition feature)를 생성할지 여부. 학습 데이터에 포함되어 있지 않더라도 생성한다. * Type: *bool* * Default value: true ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** 이 튜토리얼 워크플로우에서는 NER CRF 모델을 학습하기 위해 sample_ner_crf_train 데이터를 사용한다. 생성된 모델은 이후 다른 텍스트 데이터에서 개체명 인식을 수행하기 위해 NER CRF Predict 함수에서 사용된다. 사용된 파라미터는 다음과 같다. ++Parameters++ 1. **Sentence Column***: sent 2. **Token Column***: word 3. **POS Column***: pos 4. **Label Column***: tag 5. **Algorithm**: L-BFGS Gradient Descent 6. **c1**: 0.1 7. **c2**: 0.1 8. **Maximum number of iterations**: 100 9. **Use all possible transitions**: true ### Python ``` from brightics.function.textanalytics import ner_crf_train input_table = inputs[0] result = ner_crf_train(table=input_table, sentence_col='sent', token_col='word', pos_col='pos', label_col='tag', algorithm='lbfgs', c1=0.1, c2=0.1, max_iterations=100, all_possible_transitions=True) model = result['model'] ``` 이 파이썬 스크립트에서는 NER CRF 모델을 학습하기 위해 sample_ner_crf_train 데이터를 사용한다. 생성된 모델은 이후 다른 텍스트 데이터에서 개체명 인식을 수행하기 위해 NER CRF Predict 함수에서 사용된다.

sampleImages.label: ner_crf_train.png
sampleImages.description: In this tutorial workflow, ner_crf_train data is used to train a NER CRF model and to predict named entities. The generated model is afterward applied to another text data to predict named entity category of each word in the NER CRF Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below.
sampleImages.parameter: 1. **Sentence Column***: sent 2. **Token Column***: word 3. **POS Column***: pos 4. **Label Column***: tag 5. **Algorithm**: L-BFGS Gradient Descent 6. **c1**: 0.1 7. **c2**: 0.1 8. **Maximum number of iterations**: 100 9. **Use all possible transitions**: true

scriptExamples.code:
from brightics.function.textanalytics import ner_crf_train
input_table = inputs[0]
result = ner_crf_train(table=input_table,
                     sentence_col='sent', token_col='word', pos_col='pos', label_col='tag',
                     algorithm='lbfgs', c1=0.1, c2=0.1,
                     max_iterations=100, all_possible_transitions=True)
model = result['model']
scriptExamples.description: In this tutorial workflow, ner_crf_train data is used to train a NER CRF model and to predict named entities. The generated model is afterward applied to another text data to predict named entity category of each word in the NER CRF Predict function.
